title.narrative: Management effectiveness of target protected areas within targeted forest landscapes (using METT score)
CFM and CRM groups established with project support that have at least one woman in the executive committee
Tree farmers reached with assets or services (agroforestry and woodlots)
Protected areas under effective management (with project support)
Land area under sustainable landscape management practices
Area under agroforestry systems - in refugee-hosting areas
Forest area brought under collaborative management
Area under plantations and re-afforestation (outside of gazetted areas)
Area under improved natural resource management (community forests registered and implementing activities under management plans) -in refugee-hosting areas
Forest area brought under management plans
Tree farmers supplying the woodfuel scheme for refugee settlements
Refugee households benefitting from the woodfuel scheme for refugee settlements
People that participated in consultations on use of forest resources in targeted landscapes
Smallholder plantations established, with seedling survival rate of at least 60% after 1 year, with project support
People employed in production and processing of forest products
Proportion of UWA field staff housed on-site
Visitors at National Parks and Central Forest Reserves in target areas (annually)
